global_rules.name: Duplicate Claim Detection
global_rules.description: A claim is considered a duplicate if the same patient_id, provider_id, service_date, and CPT/HCPCS code combination exists in a previously paid claim within the same benefit year.
global_rules.recommended_action: Deny as duplicate unless accompanied by new medical documentation justifying repeat service.

global_rules.name: Service Frequency Limit Exceeded
global_rules.description: Certain procedures have annual or rolling-period utilization limits. Billing beyond the allowed frequency without prior authorization triggers a violation.
global_rules.recommended_action: Request utilization management review; deny excess units.

global_rules.name: Missing Required Diagnosis Code
global_rules.description: Every procedure line must include at least one valid ICD-10-CM diagnosis code that supports medical necessity per CMS guidelines.
global_rules.recommended_action: Return to provider for correction within 10 business days.

global_rules.name: Ineligible Member
global_rules.description: Coverage is only active for services rendered while the member’s policy status is 'active'. Claims with service dates outside active coverage are ineligible.

global_rules.name: Service Not Covered by Plan
global_rules.description: The billed CPT/HCPCS code is explicitly excluded from the member’s benefit plan and is not reimbursable under any circumstance unless a valid prior authorization is on file.
global_rules.recommended_action: Deny unless PA reference number is provided and validated.

global_rules.name: Claim Amount Exceeds Plan Threshold
global_rules.description: The total billed amount for a single claim exceeds the plan-specific maximum allowable threshold for non-itemized submissions.
global_rules.recommended_action: Escalate to financial review team; may require itemized breakdown.

global_rules.name: Missing Place of Service (POS)
global_rules.description: All professional claims must include a valid Place of Service code (e.g., 11 for office, 21 for inpatient).

global_rules.name: 501(r) Charity Care Eligibility Not Applied
global_rules.description: Patient meets income eligibility for charity care under plan rules, but claim was not adjusted to reflect financial assistance.
global_rules.recommended_action: Adjust claim to $0 or apply sliding-scale discount per charity care policy.

PLAN_A.notes: Standard commercial PPO with preventive care coverage. Excludes general health panels and non-FDA-approved services.

PLAN_B.notes: HSA-eligible HDHP. Lower thresholds to encourage cost-conscious billing.

PLAN_C.notes: State Medicaid plan with higher visit allowances. Requires state-specific eligibility verification.

history_requirements.note: Historical claims must cover at least the past 365 days for accurate duplicate and frequency checks.
